headline: Warren Buffett Takes Veiled Dig At Elon Musk While Criticizing CEO Pay Spiral: 'Envy And Greed Walk Hand In Hand'
summary: In his final annual letter as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway Inc (NYSE:BRK) (NYSE:BRK), Warren Buffett has highlighted a concerning trend of escalating CEO compensation amid Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk‘s revised pay. Buffett Criticizes CEO Pay Spiral Buffett pointed out the growing trend of CEOs increasing their own pay after witnessing their peers’ remuneration. The 95-year-old billionaire, who has been at the helm of Berkshire Hathaway for six decades, suggested that CEOs are driven by envy a

headline: Latest News In Energy Transition - China's Renewable Energy Surge Driven By Government and Technology
summary: The China Renewable Energy Market is poised for significant growth, expected to reach 5.98 GW by 2033 from 2.03 GW in 2024, driven by ambitious carbon neutrality goals and a suite of supportive government policies. This expansion is underpinned by declining costs of solar and wind technologies, advancements in grid infrastructure, and increased adoption of clean energy solutions amidst rising electricity demands due to urbanization and industrialization. The Chinese government's legislative...

headline: Elon Musk's xAI raises $15 billion in latest funding round, CNBC reports
summary: Following CNBC's September report, Musk said the ⁠company was not ‌raising any capital.  XAI, in what seemed like an automated reply, said "Legacy ‍Media Lies" in response to a Reuters request for comment on Thursday's raise.  Investor enthusiasm in artificial intelligence ⁠firms has remained strong even ​as fears of an AI bubble ​emerge due to sky high valuations and massive spending plans.

headline: Tradr Launches Leveraged ETFs on Bloom Energy, Celestica, NANO Nuclear & Synopsys
summary: Tradr ETFs, a provider of ETFs designed for sophisticated investors and professional traders, today launched four new single stock leveraged ETFs. The funds seek to deliver twice (200%) the daily performance of a specific underlying stock. Listed on Cboe, these ETFs are the first and only strategies available for this group of growth-oriented companies.

The funds seek to deliver twice (200%) the daily performance of a specific underlying stock. Listed on Cboe, these ETFs are the first and only strategies available for this group of growth-oriented companies.

headline: Jewelry Mogul Kendra Scott Built A $1 Billion Brand From $500 And A Baby In A Carrier — 'Failure Wasn't An Option,' She Said
summary: Kendra Scott built a billion-dollar jewelry company from a bedroom with $500 and her newborn son in a carrier by her side. While she was pregnant, she began wiring stones by hand and realized the market didn't offer much between luxury pieces and cheap costume jewelry. "Extra bedroom in my house, on a card table. 500 bucks, baby. That's it," she told James Dumoulin, host of "The School of Hard Knocks" podcast. Scott officially launched Kendra Scott LLC in 2002 despite having no retail background

content.title: Jewelry Mogul Kendra Scott Built A $1 Billion Brand From $500 And A Baby In A Carrier — 'Failure Wasn't An Option,' She Said
content.summary: Kendra Scott built a billion-dollar jewelry company from a bedroom with $500 and her newborn son in a carrier by her side. While she was pregnant, she began wiring stones by hand and realized the market didn't offer much between luxury pieces and cheap costume jewelry. "Extra bedroom in my house, on a card table. 500 bucks, baby. That's it," she told James Dumoulin, host of "The School of Hard Knocks" podcast. Scott officially launched Kendra Scott LLC in 2002 despite having no retail background

headline: Tesla Is Working to Add Apple CarPlay in Bid to Boost Vehicle Sales
summary: The CarPlay platform — long supported by other automakers — shows users a version of the iPhone’s software that’s optimized for vehicle infotainment systems.  Adding CarPlay would mark a stunning reversal for Tesla and Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk, who long ignored pleas to implement the popular feature.  Musk has criticized Apple for years, particularly its App Store policies, and was angered by the company’s poaching of his engineers when it set out to build its own car.

content.title: Tesla Is Working to Add Apple CarPlay in Bid to Boost Vehicle Sales
content.summary: The CarPlay platform — long supported by other automakers — shows users a version of the iPhone’s software that’s optimized for vehicle infotainment systems.  Adding CarPlay would mark a stunning reversal for Tesla and Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk, who long ignored pleas to implement the popular feature.  Musk has criticized Apple for years, particularly its App Store policies, and was angered by the company’s poaching of his engineers when it set out to build its own car.

headline: AI boom or bubble? Top Wall Street voices map what's next
summary: Is AI a bubble or a generational boom? headline: Reports: Tesla to add Apple CarPlay & Verizon to trim workforce
summary: Yahoo Finance’s Brooke DiPalma recaps some of the top stories on Wall Street. Markets (^DJI, ^GSPC, ^IXIC) are taking a tumble as investors weigh the impact of the government shutdown on the economy and the path for rate cuts. Verizon (VZ) aims to reduce its workforce, reportedly cutting about 15,000 jobs, according to the Wall Street Journal. Tesla (TSLA) is making a move to add Apple CarPlay in its electric vehicles (EVs), according to Bloomberg. For full interviews, highlights, and key insights, check out more from Yahoo Finance Invest.

content.title: Reports: Tesla to add Apple CarPlay & Verizon to trim workforce
content.description:
Yahoo Finance’s Brooke DiPalma recaps some of the top stories on Wall Street.

Markets (^DJI, ^GSPC, ^IXIC) are taking a tumble as investors weigh the impact of the government shutdown on the economy and the path for rate cuts.

Verizon (VZ) aims to reduce its workforce, reportedly cutting about 15,000 jobs, according to the Wall Street Journal.

Tesla (TSLA) is making a move to add Apple CarPlay in its electric vehicles (EVs), according to Bloomberg.

For full interviews, highlights, and key insights, check out more from Yahoo Finance Invest.

summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) close Thursday's trading session in negative territory, led by the Nasdaq Composite's intraday losses of 2.29%. This all comes after President Trump signed a federal spending bill on Wednesday, effectively reopening the government. summary: FEATURE  Stocks fell Thursday as the odds of a December rate cut retreated and the end of the longest U.S. government shutdown in history failed to boost markets. These stocks moved:  Disney shares tumbled 7.

headline: Apple Stock Outperforms Big Tech Peers During Selloff
summary: Apple  stock was down slightly on Wednesday, but still performing better than most of its Magnificent Seven peers as Wall Street rotates its investments out of tech names that are spending big on artificial intelligence.  The stock market took a hit on Thursday as investors turned their focus from the government shutdown to concerns that the Federal Reserve wouldn’t be cutting interest rates again in December.  On top of those concerns, there was a continued decline in tech stocks as investors worry about hefty AI spending and high valuations.

content.title: Apple Stock Outperforms Big Tech Peers During Selloff
content.summary: Apple  stock was down slightly on Wednesday, but still performing better than most of its Magnificent Seven peers as Wall Street rotates its investments out of tech names that are spending big on artificial intelligence.  The stock market took a hit on Thursday as investors turned their focus from the government shutdown to concerns that the Federal Reserve wouldn’t be cutting interest rates again in December.  On top of those concerns, there was a continued decline in tech stocks as investors worry about hefty AI spending and high valuations.

headline: Dow Drops 800 Points, Nasdaq Falls 2.3%. AI Worries and More Reasons the Stock Market Got Rocked Today.
summary: The stock market had its worst day in a month on Thursday after another wave of technology stock selling spread to the broader market.  The Nasdaq Composite was down 2.3%.  All three indexes marked their biggest daily declines since Oct. 10, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

content.summary: The stock market had its worst day in a month on Thursday after another wave of technology stock selling spread to the broader market.  The Nasdaq Composite was down 2.3%.  All three indexes marked their biggest daily declines since Oct. 10, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Letdown
summary: The Nasdaq composite led indexes lower, dropping 2.3%, as chip stocks including Nvidia and Broadcom were hit hard.  Flight disruptions might continue for a while, and investors are still awaiting word from federal agencies on when to expect backlogged economic data.

content.title: Heard on the Street Recap: Letdown
content.summary: The Nasdaq composite led indexes lower, dropping 2.3%, as chip stocks including Nvidia and Broadcom were hit hard.  Flight disruptions might continue for a while, and investors are still awaiting word from federal agencies on when to expect backlogged economic data.
